column4: anyone knowledgeable with veeeeeery old hardware? I just want to know, if those things (such as serial ports) plugged directly in motherboards are considererd as "PCI" or not.. ?
no, they're older than pci :)
they'll be /dev/ttyS0 on up
I've never used a serial mouse, so ....
me neither ;) this thing is OLD
yeah, the sarge business card iso
so you've been using linux for a few weeks then :)
voodoo2 is the bomb!
this isn't an old IBM, is it?
i'm curious, do the gnome resolutions work?
they work
interesting :) I'm no X guru, but I find it interesting. You only have one res available in xorg.conf?
no, a lot more nice than weird. I've struggled with configs too much.
so make a new user, log in and change the res, and let me know what happens :)
to be honest, so I can learn :)
I've got a lot of screens defined, so I'm not a good control
no, I never realized that gnome could have different res's available, so i've never looked at ti
I've only seen that happen when I had to boot in Safe Mode (every 2 or three times at the end) :)
multiple users with different resolutions work fine.
this was very timely, cuz I just helped a guy in our shelter get his own domain name. I'm delegating this machine for their use, and that's one less thing I need to worry about.
I lurk here for strange questions, I've been doing that for years here and there
